chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued

2:42 PM Defendant Anthony R Olson in court with Attorney Laura Breun in court for Anthony R Olson.  Attorney Trisha Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. Law Enforcement duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - waives argument; Ct binds case over; bail continued
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
02:14 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Laura Breun.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:50 PM Defendant appeared.  Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony R Olson appeared by video means.  Defendant was planning to hire a private attorney.  Defendant planning on applying to SPD to Laura Bruen assigned in this case as she is assigned in another case.  Case rescheduled to allow defendant to retain counsel.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jazzmyn B or Brandon P. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 5 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

11:37 AM Defendant appeared.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
